title.narrative: DESIGN SCALING UP PLANS OF NUTRITION INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: By 2020, key strategic actors in the nutrition sector are equipped with the technical skills to use data to design strategies and carry out decentralized monitoring., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, key strategic actors in the nutrition sector are equipped with the technical skills to use data to design strategies and carry out decentralized monitoring.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical and financial support to the government to revise the 2016 draft decree on the commercialization of breastmilk substitutes, to conduct the baseline study on the situational analysis of the maternal nutrition program, and to train nutrition focal points on nutrition in emergency. As the lead of the SUN UN network, UNICEF coordinated the development of a joint project on stunting prevention to be implemented in Gourma province, Est region, from February 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of key nutrition-sensitive sectors in which a nutrition module is integrated into training curricula
National guideline for preventing micronutrient deficiencies and anemia mong under-five children, adolescents and pregnant women developed
Country has a budgeted plan to eliminate water and fluids to support increase in exclusive breastfeeding
Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
